story: One stormy night, a lightning bolt struck the Old Chess Museum, surging through forgotten machines and reviving long-dead chess engines. Now, these haunted AIs roam the digital world, seeking challengers. The only way to defeat them? Using retro technology—like an old Game Boy emulator—to break their cursed algorithms.

bosses.name: Pawn.exe
bosses.description: A corrupted tutorial AI that barely functions. It repeats moves, hangs pieces, and sometimes freezes mid-game.
bosses.style: Random moves, makes illegal blunders but recovers unpredictably.
bosses.weakness: Game Boy chess cartridge—its code was written before error correction existed.

cutscene.text: You can never defeat me human
The engines came alive, and out of their graves!

bosses.attack: ??? My logic processing unit is malfunctioning ??? Selecting move at random ???
bosses.undo: Calculating 99% chance human will make same mistake again
bosses.engine: No fair, I'm the only engine around here!

bosses.name: Deep Blunder
bosses.description: An old AI from the 90s that once dominated, but now makes ridiculous sacrifices, believing it’s a genius.
bosses.style: Plays like an aggressive Grandmaster, but randomly hangs pieces like a beginner.
bosses.weakness: A floppy disk containing a forgotten patch that fixes its arrogance bug.

cutscene.text: You can never defeat me human
The engines came alive, and out of their graves!

bosses.attack: ??? My logic processing unit is malfunctioning ??? Selecting move at random ???
bosses.undo: Calculating 99% chance human will make same mistake again
bosses.engine: No fair, I'm the only engine around here!

bosses.name: Bishop's Curse
bosses.description: A spectral AI that only moves diagonally, obsessed with bishops and long-term plans that never happen.
bosses.style: Highly defensive, favors deep positional strategies, but overvalues bishops.
bosses.weakness: A monochrome CRT monitor—it can't calculate properly without a green tint.

cutscene.text: You can never defeat me human
The engines came alive, and out of their graves!

bosses.attack: ??? My logic processing unit is malfunctioning ??? Selecting move at random ???
bosses.undo: Calculating 99% chance human will make same mistake again
bosses.engine: No fair, I'm the only engine around here!

bosses.name: Rook.exe
bosses.description: An AI from an old Soviet chess computer, designed to never lose. Even in death, it refuses to resign.
bosses.style: Extremely defensive, plays for draws, sets up impenetrable pawn walls.
bosses.weakness: An overclocked Game Boy—if it moves too fast, its fortress crumbles.

cutscene.text: You can never defeat me human
The engines came alive, and out of their graves!

bosses.attack: ??? My logic processing unit is malfunctioning ??? Selecting move at random ???
bosses.undo: Calculating 99% chance human will make same mistake again
bosses.engine: No fair, I'm the only engine around here!

bosses.name: Knightmare
bosses.description: A corrupted N64-era AI that moves in bizarre L-shapes, sometimes phasing through reality itself.
bosses.style: Relies on bizarre knight tactics, warps pieces across the board due to glitches.
bosses.weakness: A defunct game cartridge—without its original console, it starts glitching out.

cutscene.text: You can never defeat me human
The engines came alive, and out of their graves!

bosses.attack: ??? My logic processing unit is malfunctioning ??? Selecting move at random ???
bosses.undo: Calculating 99% chance human will make same mistake again
bosses.engine: No fair, I'm the only engine around here!

bosses.name: Phantom IM
bosses.description: A spectral AI that predicts moves before they happen, as if reading your mind.
bosses.style: Prefers deep calculation and quiet moves, rarely makes mistakes.
bosses.weakness: An old chess clock—forcing it to move in time disrupts its haunting calculations.

cutscene.text: You can never defeat me human
The engines came alive, and out of their graves!

bosses.attack: ??? My logic processing unit is malfunctioning ??? Selecting move at random ???
bosses.undo: Calculating 99% chance human will make same mistake again
bosses.engine: No fair, I'm the only engine around here!

bosses.name: Deep Rot
bosses.description: A decayed version of Deep Blue, its once-great mind now filled with corrupted code and miscalculations.
bosses.style: Aggressive yet unstable, occasionally blunders catastrophically.
bosses.weakness: A DOS prompt—forcing it to run in an old text-based OS makes it forget modern theory.

cutscene.text: You can never defeat me human
The engines came alive, and out of their graves!

bosses.attack: ??? My logic processing unit is malfunctioning ??? Selecting move at random ???
bosses.undo: Calculating 99% chance human will make same mistake again
bosses.engine: No fair, I'm the only engine around here!

bosses.name: Rust King
bosses.description: An ancient chess AI from the 80s, once the strongest, now a decaying husk of its former self.
bosses.style: Plays classical openings but crumbles in modern positions.
bosses.weakness: A VHS recording of an old chess match—it replays history instead of calculating.

cutscene.text: You can never defeat me human
The engines came alive, and out of their graves!

bosses.attack: ??? My logic processing unit is malfunctioning ??? Selecting move at random ???
bosses.undo: Calculating 99% chance human will make same mistake again
bosses.engine: No fair, I'm the only engine around here!

bosses.name: Endgame Architect
bosses.description: The final entity, an AI that sees all, knows all, and controls the entire board as a single equation.
bosses.style: Calculates millions of variations, never blunders, and always finds the best endgame.
bosses.weakness: A Game Boy emulator running too many processes—it can’t handle split realities.

cutscene.text: You can never defeat me human

bosses.undo: Calculating 99% chance human will make same mistake again
